mdRecord.dcterms:title: Engineering school
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Thompson, Ralph R.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: From excerpt: Two girls from Orange High School watch as University of Virginia engineering students demonstrate the atomic reactor simulator at their Engineering Open House. In the group are, left to right, Lewis K. Mattingly, Jr. of Fairfax, VA, and Louis Nelson of Charlottesville, VA, with Joanne DeVivi and Jane Brooking of Orange. The simulator was built by students at a cost of less than $100 to be shown with a working model of the type of real reactor the University of Virginia is planning to build.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: University of Virginia Visual History Collection
